fulminating adjective
(DISEASE)
medical
  specialized (of a disease or condition) affecting someone very suddenly and very seriously: One patient died of fulminating septicaemia. Vitamin depletion could sometimes be responsible for fulminating neuropsychiatric disorders.
More examplesFewer examplesThe course of gastric cancer may be insidious or fulminating.Fulminating systemic lupus erythematosus is a life-threatening condition.
